intro: Hieracium murorum subsp. senjense, commonly known as the Senjens hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces numerous small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in a flat head. This subspecies is distinguished by its geographic distribution and specific morphological traits compared to other members of the Hieracium genus.
